translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We have sent revelations to you as We sent revelations to Noah and the prophets (who came) after him; and We sent revelations to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob, and their offspring, and to Jesus and Job, and to Jonah and Aaron and Solomon, and to David We gave the Book of Psalms,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed We sent a divine revelation to you (Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessing be upon him) as We did send divine revelations to Nooh (Noah) and the Prophets after him; and We sent divine revelations to Ibrahim (Abraham) and Ismael (Ishmael) and Ishaq (Isaac) and Yaqub (Jacob) and their offspring, and Eisa (Jesus) and Ayyub (Job) and Yunus (Jonah) and Haroon (Aaron) and Sulaiman (Solomon), and We bestowed the Zaboor (the Holy Book) upon Dawud (David).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We have revealed to thee as We revealed to Noah, and the Prophets after him, and We revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, Jesus and Job, Jonah and Aaron and Solomon, and We gave to David Psalms,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily We have revealed unto thee even as We revealed unto Nuh and the prophets after him, and as We revealed unto Ibrahim and Isma'il and Is-haq and Ya'qub and the tribes, and 'Isa and Ayyub and Yunus and Harun and Sulaiman, and unto Daud We vouchsafed a Scripture.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, We have inspired you (O Muhammad SAW) as We inspired Nuh (Noah) and the Prophets after him; We (also) inspired Ibrahim (Abraham), Isma'il (Ishmael), Ishaque (Isaac), Ya'qub (Jacob), and Al-Asbat [the twelve sons of Ya'qub (Jacob)], 'Iesa (Jesus), Ayub (Job), Yunus (Jonah), Harun (Aaron), and Sulaiman (Solomon), and to Dawud (David) We gave the Zabur (Psalms).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We have inspired you, as We had inspired Noah and the prophets after him. And We inspired Abraham, and Ishmael, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the Patriarchs, and Jesus, and Job, and Jonah, and Aaron, and Solomon. And We gave David the Psalms.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad!) We have revealed to you as We revealed to Noah and the Prophets after him, and We revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the offspring of Jacob, and Jesus and Job, and Jonah, and Aaron and Solomon, and We gave to David Psalms.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, We have sent the revelation to you as We sent the revelation to Nuh and the Prophets after him; We (also) sent the revelation to Ibrahim, Isma`il, Ishaq, Ya`qub, and Al-Asbat, (the offspring of the twelve sons of Ya`qub) `Isa, Ayyub, Yunus, Harun, and Sulayman; and to Dawud We gave the Zabur.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! We inspire thee as We inspired Noah and the prophets after him, as We inspired Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the tribes, and Jesus and Job and Jonah and Aaron and Solomon, and as We imparted unto David the Psalms;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We have indeed revealed to you as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him, and [as] We revealed to Abraham and Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, Jesus and Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon—and We gave David the Psalms—

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We have revealed to you as We revealed to Noah and to the Prophets after him, and We revealed to (Prophets) Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the tribes, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and We gave to David the Psalms.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And we revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), We have sent revelations to you just as were sent to Noah and the Prophets who lived after him and to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, his descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon. We gave the Psalms to David.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely We have revealed to you as We revealed to Nuh, and the prophets after him, and We revealed to Ibrahim and Ismail and Ishaq and Yaqoub and the tribes, and Isa and Ayub and Yunus and Haroun and Sulaiman and We gave to Dawood

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We have sent revelation to you [Prophet] as We did to Noah and the prophets who came after him, to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, to Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon and David, to whom We gave the Psalms.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We have sent thee inspiration, as We sent it to Noah and the Messengers after him: we sent inspiration to Abraham, Isma'il, Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes, to Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and solomon, and to David We gave the Psalms.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Recount to them the story of Noah when he said to his people: "O people, if you find my staying with you and warning through God's signs, unbearable to you, know that I have reposed my trust in God. So plan your move, and call your associates, and make certain of your plan; then do whatever you intend against me, allowing me no respite.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Noah when he said to his people, 'My people, if my standing here is grievous to you and my reminding you of the signs of God, in God have I put my trust; so resolve on your affair, with your associates, then let not your affair be a worry to you, but make decision unto me, and respite me not.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And rehearse thou unto them the story of Nuh, when he said unto his people: O my people! if my standing forth and my admonishment with the commandments of Allah be hard upon you, then on Allah I rely; so devise your affair, ye and your associate-gods and let not your affair be dubious unto you, then have it decreed against me, and respite me not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Nuh (Noah). When he said to his people: "O my people, if my stay (with you), and my reminding (you) of the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allah is hard on you, then I put my trust in Allah. So devise your plot, you and your partners, and let not your plot be in doubt for you. Then pass your sentence on me and give me no respite.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And relate to them the story of Noah, when he said to his people, “O my people, if my presence among you and my reminding you of God’s signs is too much for you, then in God I have put my trust. So come to a decision, you and your partners, and do not let the matter perplex you; then carry out your decision on me, and do not hold back.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And narrate to them the story of Noah when he said to his people: 'My people! If my living in your midst and my effort to shake you out of heedlessness by reciting to you the revelations of Allah offend you, then remember that I have put all my trust in Allah. So draw up your plan in concert with those whom you associate with Allah in His divinity, leaving no part of it obscure, and then put it into effect against me, and give me no respite.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Nuh. When he said to his people: "O my people, if my stay (with you), and my reminding (you) of the Ayat of Allah is hard on you, then I put my trust in Allah. So devise your plot, you and your partners, and let not your plot be in confusion for you. Then pass your sentence on me and give me no respite.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Recite unto them the story of Noah, when he told his people: O my people! If my sojourn (here) and my reminding you by Allah's revelations are an offence unto you, in Allah have I put my trust, so decide upon your course of action you and your partners. Let not your course of action be in doubt for you. Then have at me, give me no respite.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Relate to them the account of Noah when he said to his people, ‘O my people! If my stay [among you] be hard on you and [also] my reminding you of Allah’s signs, [for my part] I have put my trust in Allah. So conspire together, along with your partners, leaving nothing vague in your plan, then carry it out against me without giving me any respite.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Noah. He said to his nation: 'O my nation, if my standing here, reminding you of the verses of Allah grieves you, and in Allah I have put my trust; decide upon your affair with your associates, then do not let your affair worry you. Come to a decision about me, and give me no respite.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Noah, when he said to his people, "O my people, if my residence and my reminding of the signs of Allah has become burdensome upon you - then I have relied upon Allah. So resolve upon your plan and [call upon] your associates. Then let not your plan be obscure to you. Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), tell them the story of Noah who told his people, "Even if my belief and my preaching of the revelation of God seem strange to you, I put my trust in Him. Unite yourselves and seek help from your idols. You should not regret what you want to do, but should execute your plans against me without delay

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Nuh when he said to his people: O my people! if my stay and my reminding (you) by the communications of Allah is hard on you-- yet on Allah do I rely-- then resolve upon your affair and (gather) your associates, then let not your affair remain dubious to you, then have it executed against me and give me no respite:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell them the story of Noah. He said to his people, "My people, if my presence among you and my preaching to you of God's revelations offends you, know that I put my trust in God, so agree on your course of action, along with your partner-gods, and let no hesitation deflect you from it, then put it into effect against me, and give me no respite.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Relate to them the story of Noah. Behold! he said to his people: "O my people, if it be hard on your (mind) that I should stay (with you) and commemorate the signs of Allah,- yet I put my trust in Allah. Get ye then an agreement about your plan and among your partners, so your plan be on to you dark and dubious. Then pass your sentence on me, and give me no respite.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people (and he said): "I give you a clear warning.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent Noah to his people: 'I am for you a warner, and a bearer of good tidings:

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Nuh unto his people saying: verily I am unto you a plain warner.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people (and he said): "I have come to you as a plain warner."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people, “I am to you a clear warner.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (Such were the circumstances) when We sent forth Noah to his people. (He said): 'I have been sent to you to warn you plainly

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We sent Nuh to his people (and he said): "I have come to you as a plain warner."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We sent Noah unto his folk (and he said): Lo! I am a plain warner unto you.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Noah to his people [to declare]: ‘Indeed I am a manifest warner to you.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Noah to his nation. (He said:) 'I am a warner for you, and a bearer of glad tidings.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people to give them the clear warning

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Nuh to his people: Surely I am a plain warner for you:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people. He said, "I have come to you with a clear warning:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people (with a mission): "I have come to you with a Clear Warning:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "O Noah, you have argued with us, and disputed at length; so bring that (retribution) you promise, if you speak the truth."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Noah, thou hast disputed with us and make much disputation with us. Then bring us that thou promisest us, if thou speakest truly.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: O Nuh! surely thou hast disputed with us and hath multiplied the disputation with us; now bring us that wherewith thou threatenest us, if thou be of the truth-tellers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "O Nuh (Noah)! You have disputed with us and much have you prolonged the dispute with us, now bring upon us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “O Noah, you have argued with us, and argued a great deal. Now bring upon us what you threaten us with, if you are truthful.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: 'O Noah! Surely you have disputed with us and have prolonged your dispute. Now bring upon us the chastisement that you threaten us with; do so, if you are truthful.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "O Nuh! You have disputed with us, and much have you prolonged the dispute with us, now bring upon us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: O Noah! Thou hast disputed with us and multiplied disputation with us; now bring upon us that wherewith thou threatenest us, if thou art of the truthful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘O Noah, you have disputed with us already, and you have disputed with us exceedingly. Now bring us what you threaten us with, should you be truthful.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'O Noah, you have disputed, and disputed too much, with us. Bring (down) upon us that which you promised us, if what you say is true'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "O Noah, you have disputed us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "Noah, you have argued with us a great deal. Bring down on us whatever torment with which you have been threatening us if what you say is true".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: O Nuh! indeed you have disputed with us and lengthened dispute with us, therefore bring to us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful ones.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "Noah," they replied, "you have argued with us, and argued to excess. Now bring down upon us what you threaten us with, if you speak the truth!?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "O Noah! thou hast disputed with us, and (much) hast thou prolonged the dispute with us: now bring upon us what thou threatenest us with, if thou speakest the truth!?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And Noah was informed through revelation: "Apart from those who have come to believe already not one of your people is going to believe. So grieve not for what they are doing.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And it was revealed to Noah, saying, 'None of thy people shall believe but he who has already believed; so be thou not distressed by that they may be doing.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And it was revealed unto Nuh: verily none of thy people will believe save those that have believed already; so be not distressed for that which they have been doing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And it was inspired to Nuh (Noah): "None of your people will believe except those who have believed already. So be not sad because of what they used to do.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And it was revealed to Noah: “None of your people will believe, except those who have already believed, so do not grieve over what they do.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: It was revealed to Noah that no more of your people, other than those who already believe, will ever come to believe. So do not grieve over their deeds,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And it was revealed to Nuh: "None of your people will believe except those who have believed already. So be not sad because of what they used to do.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And it was inspired in Noah, (saying): No-one of thy folk will believe save him who hath believed already. Be not distressed because of what they do.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: It was revealed to Noah: ‘None of your people will believe except those who already have faith; so do not sorrow for what they used to do.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And it was revealed to Noah: 'None of your nation will believe except whosoever has already believed. Do not distress yourself with what they may do.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And it was revealed to Noah that, "No one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: It was revealed to Noah that besides those who had already accepted his faith, no one from his people would ever believe him. He was told not to be disappointed about what his people had done,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And it was revealed to Nuh: That none of your people will believe except those who have already believed, therefore do not grieve at what they do:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God's will was revealed to Noah, "No more of your people will believe in you than those who already believe; do not grieve, therefore, over what they have been doing.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: It was revealed to Noah: "None of thy people will believe except those who have believed already! So grieve no longer over their (evil) deeds.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: It sailed on waves like mountains (high), and Noah called to his son who was separated from him: "Embark with us, O my son, and be not one of those who do not believe."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So it ran with them amid waves like mountains; and Noah called to his son, who was standing apart, 'Embark with us, my son, and be thou not with the unbelievers!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And it moved on with them amidst waves like mountains. And Nuh called out his son, and he was apart: O my son! embark with us, and be not with the infidels.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So it (the ship) sailed with them amidst the waves like mountains, and Nuh (Noah) called out to his son, who had separated himself (apart), "O my son! Embark with us and be not with the disbelievers."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And so it sailed with them amidst waves like hills. And Noah called to his son, who had kept away, “On my son! Embark with us, and do not be with the disbelievers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The Ark sailed along with them amid mountain-like waves. Noah, spotting his son at a distance, called out to him: 'My son. embark with us. and do not be with the unbelievers.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So it (the ship) sailed with them amidst waves like mountains, and Nuh called out to his son, who had separated himself (apart): "O my son! Embark with us and be not with the disbelievers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And it sailed with them amid waves like mountains, and Noah cried unto his son - and he was standing aloof - O my son! Come ride with us, and be not with the disbelievers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And it sailed along with them amid waves [rising] like mountains. Noah called out to his son, who stood aloof, ‘O my son! ‘Board with us, and do not be with the faithless!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And so it (the Ark) ran with them amidst the mountainous waves, and Noah cried out to his son, who was standing apart, 'Embark with us, my son, do not be with the unbelievers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And it sailed with them through waves like mountains, and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them], "O my son, come aboard with us and be not with the disbelievers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the Ark sailed on with them amid the mountainous waves, Noah called out to his son who kept away from them, "My son, embark with us. Do not stay with the unbelievers."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And it moved on with them amid waves like mountains; and Nuh called out to his son, and he was aloof: O my son! embark with us and be not with the unbelievers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The Ark sailed along with them through mountainous waves. Noah called out to his son who stood apart, "O my son! Embark with us and do not be among the deniers!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So the Ark floated with them on the waves (towering) like mountains, and Noah called out to his son, who had separated himself (from the rest): "O my son! embark with us, and be not with the unbelievers!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Noah called on his Lord and said: "O Lord, my son is surely a member of my family, and verily Your promise is true, as You are the most just of all judges."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Noah called unto his Lord, and said, 'O my Lord, my son is of my family, and Thy promise is surely the truth. Thou art the justest of those that judge.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Nuh cried unto his Lord, and said: my Lord! verily my son is of my household, and verily Thine promise is the truth: and Thou art the Greatest of the rulers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Nuh (Noah) called upon his Lord and said, "O my Lord! Verily, my son is of my family! And certainly, Your Promise is true, and You are the Most Just of the judges."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Noah called to his Lord. He said, “O My Lord, my son is of my family, and Your promise is true, and You are the Wisest of the wise.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Noah called out to his Lord, saying: 'My Lord! My son is of my family. Surely Your promise is true, and You are the greatest of those who judge.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Nuh called upon his Lord and said, "O my Lord! Verily, my son is of my family! And certainly, Your promise is true, and You are the Most Just of the judges."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Noah cried unto his Lord and said: My Lord! Lo! my son is of my household! Surely Thy promise is the truth and Thou are the Most Just of Judges.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Noah called out to his Lord, and said, ‘My Lord! My son is indeed from my family. Your promise is indeed true, and You are the fairest of all judges.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Noah called out to his Lord, saying: 'O Lord, my son was of my family, and Your promise is surely the truth. You are the most Just of judges'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Noah called to his Lord and said, "My Lord, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most just of judges!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Noah prayed to his Lord saying, "Lord, my son is a member of my family. Your promise is always true and you are the best Judge".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Nuh cried out to his Lord and said: My Lord! surely my son is of my family, and Thy promise is surely true, and Thou art the most just of the judges.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Noah called out to his Lord, saying, "My Lord, my son was a part of my family. Your promise was surely true. You are the most just of all judges."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And Noah called upon his Lord, and said: "O my Lord! surely my son is of my family! and Thy promise is true, and Thou art the justest of Judges!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (And the Lord) said: "O Noah, disembark with peace and safety from Us and blessings on you and the people with you. As for some (of them), We shall bestow advantages for a time, then send a grievous punishment on them."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: It was said, 'Noah, get thee down in peace from Us, and blessings upon thee and on the nations of those with thee; and nations -- We shall give them enjoyment, then there shall visit them from Us a painful chastisement.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: It was said: Nuh! get thou down with peace from us and blessings upon thee and the communities with thee. And there shall be communities whom we shall let enjoy themselves, and thereafter there shall befall them from us a torment afflictive.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: It was said: "O Nuh (Noah)! Come down (from the ship) with peace from Us and blessings on you and on the people who are with you (and on some of their off spring), but (there will be other) people to whom We shall grant their pleasures (for a time), but in the end a painful torment will reach them from Us."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: It was said, “O Noah, disembark with peace from Us; and with blessings upon you, and upon communities from those with you. And other communities We will grant prosperity, and then a painful torment from Us will befall them.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: It was said: 'Noah! Disembark, with Our peace, and with blessings upon you and upon those who are with you. There are also people whom We shall allow to enjoy themselves for a while, and then a painful chastisement from Us shall afflict them.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: It was said: "O Nuh! Come down (from the ship) with peace from Us and blessings on you and on the people who are with you (and on some of their offspring), but (there will be other) people to whom We shall grant their pleasures (for a time), but in the end a painful torment will reach them from Us."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: It was said (unto him): O Noah! Go thou down (from the mountain) with peace from Us and blessings upon thee and some nations (that will spring) from those with thee. (There will be other) nations unto whom We shall give enjoyment a long while and then a painful doom from Us will overtake them.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: It was said, ‘O Noah! Disembark in peace from Us and with [Our] blessings upon you and upon nations [to descend] from those who are with you, and nations whom We shall provide for, then a painful punishment from Us shall befall them.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: It was said: 'O Noah, descend with peace from Us and blessings on you and on the nations of those with you; and nations We shall give them enjoyment, and then from Us they shall be visited with a painful punishment'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: It was said, "O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment; then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Noah was told, "Get down from the Ark. Your Lord's peace and blessings are upon you and your followers. Your Lord will grant favors to other nations and then afflict them with a painful torment."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: It was said: O Nuh! descend with peace from Us and blessings on you and on the people from among those who are with you, and there shall be nations whom We will afford provisions, then a painful punishment from Us shall afflict them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God said, "Noah, go ashore in peace; Our blessings upon you and upon the people who are with you and upon some of the descendants of those who are with you. [As for the unrighteous] We shall grant provision for a time, then a grievous punishment from Us shall afflict them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The word came: "O Noah! Come down (from the Ark) with peace from Us, and blessing on thee and on some of the peoples (who will spring) from those with thee: but (there will be other) peoples to whom We shall grant their pleasures (for a time), but in the end will a grievous penalty reach them from Us."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "O my people (I fear) lest your opposition to me should bring you the like of what befell the people of Noah or Hud or Saleh; and the people of Lot are not distant from you.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: O my people, let not the breach with me move you, so that there smite you the like of what smote the people of Noah, or the people of Hood, or the people of Salih; and the people of Lot are not far away from you.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And, O my people! let not the cleavage with me incite you so that there befall you the like of that which befell the people of Nuh and the people of Hud and the people of Saleh; and the people of Lut are not from you far away.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And O my people! Let not my Shiqaqcause you to suffer the fate similar to that of the people of Nuh (Noah) or of Hud or of Salih (Saleh), and the people of Lout (Lot) are not far off from you!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “O my people, let not your hostility towards me cause you to suffer what was suffered by the people of Noah, or the people of Hud, or the people of Saleh. The people of Lot are not far away from you.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: My people! Let not your opposition to me lead you to guilt that would bring upon you the chastisement that struck earlier the people of Noah, and the people of Hud, and the people of Salih. And the land of the people of Lot is not far from you!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And O my people! Let not my Shiqaq cause you to suffer the fate similar to that of the people of Nuh or of Hud or of Salih, and the people of Lut are not far off from you!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And, O my people! Let not the schism with me cause you to sin so that there befall you that which befell the folk of Noah and the folk of Hud, and the folk of Salih; and the folk of Lot are not far off from you.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: O my people, do not let your defiance toward me lead you to be visited by the like of what was visited on the people of Noah, or the people of Hud, or the people of Salih, and the people of Lot are not distant from you.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And my nation, do not let your breaking with me bring upon you something similar to that which struck the nation of Noah, Hood, and Salih and it is not long since the people of Lot (were punished).

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And O my people, let not [your] dissension from me cause you to be struck by that similar to what struck the people of Noah or the people of Hud or the people of Salih. And the people of Lot are not from you far away.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: My people, do not let your opposition to me lead you to commit sins or make you suffer what the people of Noah, Hud, and Salih suffered. Remember that the people of Lot were destroyed not very long ago.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And, O my people! let not opposition to me make you guilty so that there may befall you the like of what befell the people of Nuh, or the people of Hud, or the people of Salih, nor are the people of Lut far off from you;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: O my people, do not let your opposition to me bring upon you a fate similar to the peoples of Noah or Hud or Salih; nor is it long since the people of Lot were punished!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And O my people! let not my dissent (from you) cause you to sin, lest ye suffer a fate similar to that of the people of Noah or of Hud or of Salih, nor are the people of Lut far off from you!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O you, the offspring of those We bore (in the ark) with Noah, he was indeed a grateful votary.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The seed of those We bore with Noah; he was a thankful servant.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O progeny of those whom We bare with Nuh: verily he was a bondman grateful.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O offspring of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh (Noah)! Verily, he was a grateful slave."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The descendants of those We carried with Noah. He was an appreciative servant.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: You are the descendants of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah. He was truly a thankful servant.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O offspring of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh! Verily, he was a grateful servant."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (They were) the seed of those whom We carried (in the ship) along with Noah. Lo! he was a grateful slave.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: descendants of those whom We carried [in the ark] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (You are) the descendants of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah. He was a truly thankful worshiper'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (We made it a guide for) the offspring of those whom We carried in the Ark with Noah, a thankful servant (of God).

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The offspring of those whom We bore with Nuh; surely he was a grateful servant.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: you who are the descendants of those whom We carried in the Ark with Noah. He was a truly thankful servant."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O ye that are sprung from those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah! Verily he was a devotee most grateful.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: These are (some of) those who were favoured by God among the prophets of the progeny of Adam, and of those We bore in the ark with Noah, and the offspring of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and We chose, for they bowed weeping in adoration when the revelations of Ar-Rahman were recited to them.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: These are they whom God has blessed among the Prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those We bore with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: These are they whom Allah hath favoured, from among the prophets, of the progeny of Adam and of them whom We bare with Nuh, and of the progeny of Ibrahim and Isra'il, and of those whom We have guided and chosen; whenever the revelations of the Compassionate were rehearsed unto them, they fell down prostrating themselves and weeping. *Chapter: 19

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His Grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh (Noah), and of the offspring of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Israel and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Verses of the Most Beneficent (Allah) were recited unto them, they fell down prostrating and weeping.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: These are some of the prophets God has blessed, from the descendants of Adam, and from those We carried with Noah, and from the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and from those We guided and selected. Whenever the revelations of the Most Gracious are recited to them, they would fall down, prostrating and weeping.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: These are the Prophets upon whom Allah bestowed His favour from the seed of Adam, and from the seed of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and from the seed of Abraham and Israel. They were those whom We guided and chose (for an exalted position). They were such that when the words of the Most Compassionate Lord were recited to them, they fell down in prostration, weeping.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh, and of the offspring of Ibrahim and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Ayat of the Most Gracious were recited unto them, they fell down prostrate and weeping.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: These are they unto whom Allah showed favour from among the prophets, of the seed of Adam and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the revelations of the Beneficent were recited unto them, they fell down, adoring and weeping.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They are the ones whom Allah has blessed from among the prophets of Adam’s progeny, and from [the progeny of] those We carried with Noah, and from among the progeny of Abraham and Israel, and from among those that We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-beneficent were recited to them, they would fall down weeping in prostration.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: These are whom Allah has blessed among the Prophets from among the seed of Adam and of those whom We bore with Noah; the descendants ofAbraham, of Israel, and of those whom We have guided and chose. For when the verses of the Merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: These were the Prophets from the offspring of Adam, from those who embarked with Noah and from the offspring of Abraham and Israel. God guided them and chose them for His favor. Whenever they would hear the revelations of the Beneficent God they would bow down in prostration with tears.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: These are they on whom Allah bestowed favors, from among the prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those whom We carried with Nuh, and of the seed of Ibrahim and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose; when the communications of the Beneficent Allah were recited to them, they fell down making obeisance and weeping.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: These are the ones whom God has favoured: the prophets from among the descendants of Adam and of those whom We carried in the Ark with Noah; the descendants of Abraham, of Israel, and of those whom We have guided and chosen. For when the revelations of the Merciful were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating themselves and weeping.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember Noah when he called to Us before this. We heard him and saved him and those with him from great distress;

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Noah -- when he called before, and We answered him, and delivered him and his people from the great distress,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Nuh! recall what time he cried aforetime; so we answered him and delivered him and his house hold from a calamity mighty.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) Nuh (Noah), when he cried (to Us) aforetime. We listened to his invocation and saved him and his family from great distress.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Noah, when he called before. So We answered him, and delivered him and his family from the great disaster.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We bestowed the same favour upon Noah. Recall, when he cried to Us before; We accepted his prayer and delivered him and his household from the great distress

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) Nuh, when he cried (to Us) aforetime. We answered to his invocation and saved him and his family from the great distress.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Noah, when he cried of old, We heard his prayer and saved him and his household from the great affliction.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And before that Noah, when he called out, We responded to him and delivered him and his family from the great agony.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And (remember) Noah, when he supplicated to Us, We answered him, and We saved him and his nation from great distress,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We answered the prayer of Noah who had prayed to Us before and saved him and his followers from the great disaster.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Nuh, when he cried aforetime, so We answered him, and delivered him and his followers from the great calamity.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Before him Noah cried out to Us, and We heard his prayer. We saved him and all his household from a great distress.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Remember) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to his (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great distress.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people. He said: "O my people, worship God, for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed for yourselves?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent Noah to his people; and he, said, 'O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He. Will you not be godfearing?"

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Nuh unto his people, and he said: O my people! worship Allah; for you there is no god but he; will ye not then fear Him!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people, and he said: "O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other Ilah (God) but Him (Islamic Monotheism). Will you not then be afraid (of Him i.e. of His Punishment because of worshipping others besides Him)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people. He said, “O my people, worship God, you have no deity other than Him. Will you not take heed?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people, and he said: "My people! Serve Allah; you have no deity other than He. Do you have no fear?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We sent Nuh to his people, and he said: "O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other God but Him. Will you not then have Taqwa"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily sent Noah unto his folk, and he said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Noah to his people, and he said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Will you not then be wary [of Him]?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Noah to his nation. 'Worship Allah, my nation' he said, 'for you have no god except He. Will you not be cautious'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people who said, "My people, worship God for He is your only Lord. Will you then not have fear of Him?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Nuh to his people, and he said: O my people! serve Allah, you have no god other than Him; will you not then guard (against evil)?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people, and he said, "My people, worship God; you have no other deity except Him. Will you not fear Him?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Further, We sent a long line of prophets for your instruction). We sent Noah to his people: He said, "O my people! worship Allah! Ye have no other god but Him. Will ye not fear (Him)?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When their brother Noah said to them: "Will you not take heed?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: when their brother Noah said to them, 'Will you not be godfearing?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: When their brother Nuh said Unto them: fear ye not?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When their brother Nuh (Noah) said to them: "Will you not fear Allah and obey Him?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Their brother Noah said to them, “Do you not fear?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Recall when their brother Noah said to them: "Do you have no fear?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When their brother Nuh said to them: "Will you not have Taqwa"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When their brother Noah said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: when Noah, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: when Noah, their brother, said to them: 'Will you not be cautious?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: span class="col">Their brother Noah asked them, "Why do you not fear God?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When their brother Nuh said to them: Will you not guard (against evil)?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you have no fear of God?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold, their brother Noah said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people, and he lived with them a thousand years minus fifty. Then they were caught by the deluge for they were evil.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he tarried among them a thousand years, all but fifty; so the Flood seized them, while they were evildoers.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Nuh unto his people. Then he tarried among them for a thousand years, save tifty years; and then deluge overtook them, while they were wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people, and he stayed among them a thousand years less fifty years [inviting them to believe in the Oneness of Allah (Monotheism), and discard the false gods and other deities], and the Deluge overtook them while they were Zalimun (wrong-doers, polytheists, disbelievers, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people, and He stayed among them for a thousand years minus fifty years. Then the Deluge swept them; for they were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We did indeed send Noah to his people and he lived among them a thousand years save fifty. Eventually the Flood overtook them while they were engaged in wrongdoing.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We sent Nuh to his people, and he stayed among them a thousand years less fifty years; so the Deluge overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily we sent Noah (as Our messenger) unto his folk, and he continued with them for a thousand years save fifty years; and the flood engulfed them, for they were wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Noah to his people, and he remained with them for a thousand-less-fifty years. Then the flood overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Indeed, We sent Noah to his nation, and he lived amongst them for a thousand years, less fifty (but they belied him), then the Flood seized them while they were harmdoers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people and he lived with them for nine hundred and fifty years, then the flood engulfed them for their injustice.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Nuh to his people, so he remained among them a thousand years save fifty years. And the deluge overtook them, while they were unjust.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people and he lived among them for fifty short of a thousand years; then the deluge overtook them, for they were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We (once) sent Noah to his people, and he tarried among them a thousand years less fifty: but the Deluge overwhelmed them while they (persisted in) sin.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When We made the covenant with the prophets, and with you, as with Noah and Abraham, Moses and Jesus son of Mary, a binding covenant,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We took compact from the Prophets, and from thee, and from Noah, and Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, Mary's son; We took from them a solemn compact,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We took a bond from the prophets and from thee and from Nuh and Ibrahim and Musa and 'Isa son of Maryam. And We took from them a solemn bond;

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We took from the Prophets their covenant, and from you (O Muhammad SAW), and from Nuh (Noah), Ibrahim (Abraham), Musa (Moses), and 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary). We took from them a strong covenant.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Recall that We received a pledge from the prophets, and from you, and from Noah, and Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus son of Mary. We received from them a solemn pledge.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And call to mind, (O Prophet), when We took the covenant from all Prophets; and also from you and Noah and Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary. We took from them a solemn covenant

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when We took from the Prophets their covenant, and from you, and from Nuh, Ibrahim, Musa, and `Isa son of Maryam. We took from them a strong covenant.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We exacted a covenant from the prophets, and from thee (O Muhammad) and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus son of Mary. We took from them a solemn covenant;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: [Recall] when We took a pledge from the prophets, and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus son of Mary, and We took from them a solemn pledge,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We took from the Prophets their covenant and from you (Prophet Muhammad), from Noah and Abraham, from Moses and Jesus the son of Mary. We took a solemn covenant from them,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We took from the prophets their covenant and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary; and We took from them a solemn covenant.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We had a solemn covenant with you (Muhammad), and the Prophets: Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, the son of Mary.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We made a covenant with the prophets and with you, and with Nuh and Ibrahim and Musa and Isa, son of Marium, and We made with them a strong covenant

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We took a solemn pledge from the prophets, from you and Noah, Abraham, Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary -- We took a solemn pledge from all of them.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember We took from the prophets their covenant: As (We did) from thee: from Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary: We took from them a solemn covenant:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Noah had verily called to Us. And how gracious was He who answered (him).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Noah called to Us; and how excellent were the Answerers!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly Nuh cried Unto us; and We are the Best of answerers!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed Nuh (Noah) invoked Us, and We are the Best of those who answer (the request).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Noah called out to Us, and We are the Best of responders.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Noah had called upon Us (earlier). See, how excellent We were in answering him!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed Nuh invoked Us, and We are the best of those who answer.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Noah verily prayed unto Us, and gracious was the Hearer of his prayer

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly Noah called out to Us, and how well did We respond!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Noah called to Us, and We are the Best to answer.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Noah called for help. How blessed was the answer which he received.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Nuh did certainly call upon Us, and most excellent answerer of prayer are We.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Noah cried to Us, and how excellent was Our response!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (In the days of old), Noah cried to Us, and We are the best to hear prayer.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Peace on Noah among all men.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'Peace be upon Noah among all beings!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Peace be on Nuh among the worlds.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Salamun (peace) be upon Nuh (Noah) (from Us) among the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Peace be upon Noah among all people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Salam (peace!) be upon Nuh among the all creatures!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Peace be unto Noah among the peoples!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Peace to Noah, throughout the nations!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Peace be upon Noah among all the worlds'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: "Peace upon Noah among the worlds."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Peace be with Noah among all men in the worlds.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Peace and salutation to Nuh among the nations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Peace be upon Noah among all the peoples!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Peace and salutation to Noah among the nations!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: God had chosen Adam and Noah and the families of Abraham and 'Imran in preference to others.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: God chose Adam and Noah and the House of Abraham and the House of Imran above all beings, the

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily did Allah choose Adam and Nuh and the house of lbrahim and the house of 'lmran out of the worlds

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Allah chose Adam, Nuh (Noah), the family of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the family of 'Imran above the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns) (of their times).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: God chose Adam, and Noah, and the family of Abraham, and the family of Imran, over all mankind.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Truly Allah chose Adam and Noah and the descendants of Abraham and of 'Imran above all mankind.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Allah chose Adam, Nuh (Noah), the family of Ibrahim and the family of `Imran above the nations.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! Allah preferred Adam and Noah and the Family of Abraham and the Family of 'Imran above (all His) creatures.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed Allah chose Adam and Noah, and the progeny of Abraham and the progeny of Imran above all the nations;

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Allah chose Adam and Noah, the House of Abraham and the House of Imran above all worlds.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: God chose (and gave distinction to) Adam, Noah, the family of Abraham, and Imran over all the people of the world.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely Allah chose Adam and Nuh and the descendants of Ibrahim and the descendants of Imran above the nations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran above all His creatures.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Allah did choose Adam and Noah, the family of Abraham, and the family of 'Imran above all people,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The people of Noah had denied before them, and many factions after them. Every nation has intrigued against its apostle and afflicted him, and argued with false arguments to condemn the truth. Then I seized them. How was then My retribution!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The people of Noah before them also cried lies, and the parties after them; every nation purposed against their Messenger to seize him, and disputed with falsehood that they might rebut thereby the truth. Then I seized them; and how was My retribution!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: The people of Nuh and the confederates after them belied their apostles before these, and each disbelieving community advanced toward their apostle that they may lay hold of him and disputed with vain speech that they may confute the truth thereby. Wherefore I laid hold of them; and how terrible was My chastisement!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The people of Nuh (Noah) and the confederates after them denied (their Messengers) before these, and every (disbelieving) nation plotted against their Messenger to seize him, and disputed by means of falsehood to refute therewith the truth. So I seized them (with punishment), and how (terrible) was My punishment!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah rejected the truth, as did the confederates after them. Every community plotted against their messenger, to capture him. And they argued with falsehood, to defeat with it the truth. But I seized them. What a punishment it was!

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah also gave the lie (to Messengers), and so did many parties after them. Each nation sallied forth against its Messenger to seize him, and they disputed with false arguments seeking therewith to repudiate the Truth. Then I seized them; and behold, how woeful was My retribution!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The people of Nuh and the groups after them denied before these; and every nation plotted against their Messenger to seize him, and disputed by means of falsehood to refute therewith the truth. So I seized them, and how was My punishment!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The folk of Noah and the factions after them denied (their messengers) before these, and every nation purposed to seize their messenger and argued falsely, (thinking) thereby to refute the Truth. Then I seized them, and how (awful) was My punishment.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The people of Noah denied before them and the [heathen] factions [who came] after them. Every nation attempted to lay hands on their apostle, and disputed erroneously to refute the truth. Then I seized them; so how was My retribution?!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The nation of Noah before them belied, and so did the parties after them. Every nation strove against their Messenger to seize him, disputing with false arguments to refute the truth. Then I seized them, how was My punishment!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The people of Noah denied before them and the [disbelieving] factions after them, and every nation intended [a plot] for their messenger to seize him, and they disputed by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth. So I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of Noah who lived before and the Confederate tribes who lived after them rejected Our revelations. Every nation schemed against its Messengers to seize them and disputed against them to defeat the truth. But torment struck them and how terrible was their retribution!

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The people of Nuh and the parties after them rejected (prophets) before them, and every nation purposed against their apostle to destroy him, and they disputed by means of the falsehood that they might thereby render null the truth, therefore I destroyed them; how was then My retribution!

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The people of Noah and later factions also rejected the truth and every community plotted against the messenger sent to them, aiming to lay hands on him, and they contended [against his message] with fallacious arguments, so that they might defeat the truth, therefore I seized them. How terrible was My punishment.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But (there were people) before them, who denied (the Signs),- the People of Noah, and the Confederates (of Evil) after them; and every People plotted against their prophet, to seize him, and disputed by means of vanities, therewith to condemn the Truth; but it was I that seized them! and how (terrible) was My Requital!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He has laid down for you the (same) way of life and belief which He had commended to Noah, and which We have enjoined on you, and which We had bequeathed to Abraham, Moses and Jesus, so that they should maintain the order and not be divided among themselves. Heavy is to idolaters what you invite them to. God chooses whom He please for Himself, and guides to Himself whoever turns to Him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He has laid down for you as religion that He charged Noah with, and that We have revealed to thee, and that We charged Abraham with, Moses and Jesus: 'Perform the religion, and scatter not regarding it. Very hateful is that for the idolaters, that thou callest them to. God chooses unto Himself whomsoever He will, and He guides to Himself whosoever turns, penitent.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He hath instituted for you in religion that which He had enjoined upon Nuh, and which We have revealed Unto thee, and which We had enjoined upon Ibrahim and Musa and Isa, saying: establish the religion, and be not divided therein. Grievous Unto the associaters is that Unto which thou callest them. Allah chooseth for Himself whomsoever He will and guideth Unto Himself whomsoever turneth in penitence.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He (Allah) has ordained for you the same religion (Islam) which He ordained for Nuh (Noah), and that which We have inspired in you (O Muhammad SAW), and that which We ordained for Ibrahim (Abraham), Musa (Moses) and 'Iesa (Jesus) saying you should establish religion (i.e. to do what it orders you to do practically), and make no divisions in it (religion) (i.e. various sects in religion). Intolerable for the Mushrikun, is that to which you (O Muhammad SAW) call them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills, and guides unto Himself who turns to Him in repentance and in obedience.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He prescribed for you the same religion He enjoined upon Noah, and what We inspired to you, and what We enjoined upon Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus: “You shall uphold the religion, and be not divided therein.” As for the idolaters, what you call them to is outrageous to them. God chooses to Himself whom He wills, and He guides to Himself whoever repents.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He has prescribed for you the religion which He enjoined upon Noah and which We revealed to you (O Muhammad), and which We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus, commanding: “Establish this religion and do not split up regarding it.” What you are calling to is very hard upon those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity. Allah chooses for Himself whomsoever He pleases and guides to Himself whoever penitently turns to Him.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He (Allah) has ordained for you the same religion which He ordained for Nuh, and that which We have revealed to you, and that which We ordained for Ibrahim, Musa and `Isa saying you should establish religion and make no divisions in it. Intolerable for the idolators is that to which you call them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills, and guides unto Himself who turns to Him in repentance.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He hath ordained for you that religion which He commended unto Noah, and that which We inspire in thee (Muhammad), and that which We commended unto Abraham and Moses and Jesus, saying: Establish the religion, and be not divided therein. Dreadful for the idolaters is that unto which thou callest them. Allah chooseth for Himself whom He will, and guideth unto Himself him who turneth (toward Him).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He has prescribed for you the religion which He had enjoined upon Noah and which We have [also] revealed to you, and which We had enjoined upon Abraham, Moses and Jesus, declaring, ‘Maintain the religion, and do not be divided in it.’ Hard on the polytheists is that to which you summon them. Allah chooses for it whomever He wishes, and He guides to it whomever returns penitently [to Him].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He has made plain for you the Religion with which He charged Noah and that which We have revealed to you, and that with which We charged (Prophets) Abraham, Moses and Jesus, (saying): 'Establish the Religion and do not be divided therein' That which you invite them to is too overwhelming for the idolaters. Allah brings close to Himself whom He will, and guides to Him those who turn in repentance.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with Allah is that to which you invite them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He has plainly clarified the religion which is revealed to you and that which Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus were commanded to follow (He has explained it) so that you would be steadfast and united in your religion. What you call the pagans to is extremely grave for them. God attracts to (the religion) whomever He wants and guides to it whoever turns to Him in repentance.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He has made plain to you of the religion what He enjoined upon Nuh and that which We have revealed to you and that which We enjoined upon Ibrahim and Musa and Isa that keep to obedience and be not divided therein; hard to the unbelievers is that which you call them to; Allah chooses for Himself whom He pleases, and guides to Himself him who turns (to Him), frequently.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God has ordained for you the same religion which He enjoined on Noah, and which We have revealed to you, and which We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus, so that you should remain steadfast in religion and not become divided in it. What you call upon the polytheists to do is hard for them; God chooses for Himself whoever He pleases and guides towards Himself those who turn to Him.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The same religion has He established for you as that which He enjoined on Noah - the which We have sent by inspiration to thee - and that which We enjoined on Abraham, Moses, and Jesus: Namely, that ye should remain steadfast in religion, and make no divisions therein: to those who worship other things than Allah, hard is the (way) to which thou callest them. Allah chooses to Himself those whom He pleases, and guides to Himself those who turn (to Him).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (So had We destroyed) the people of Noah before them: They were surely a sinful people.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And the people of Noah before; surely they were an ungodly people.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And the people of Nuh We destroyed aforetime; verily they were a people transgressing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: (So were) the people of Nuh (Noah) before them. Verily, they were a people who were Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And before that, the people of Noah. They were immoral people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Before all these We destroyed the people of Noah: they were a wicked people.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (So were) the people of Nuh before them. Verily, they were a people who were rebellious.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And the folk of Noah aforetime. Lo! they were licentious folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And the people of Noah aforetime. Indeed, they were a transgressing lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And before them the nation of Noah, indeed they were a debauched nation.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of Noah who lived before them were also evil doing people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the people of Nuh before, surely they were a transgressing people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [We destroyed] the people of Noah before them. They were certainly a sinful people.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So were the People of Noah before them for they wickedly transgressed.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Like the people of Noah before them, who were surely oppressors and rebellious;

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and the people of Noah before -- certainly they did exceeding evil, and were insolent

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And also the people of Nuh aforetime. Verily they were even greater wrong-doers and more contumacious.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And the people of Nuh (Noah) aforetime, verily, they were more unjust and more rebellious and transgressing [in disobeying Allah and His Messenger Nuh (Noah)].

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And the people of Noah before that; for they were most unjust and most oppressive.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and that He it is Who destroyed the people of Noah before for they were much given to iniquity and transgression.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And the people of Nuh aforetime. Verily, they were more unjust and more rebellious and transgressing.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And the folk of Noah aforetime, Lo! they were more unjust and more rebellious;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and the people of Noah before that; indeed they were more unjust and rebellious;

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and before them the nation of Noah, they exceeded in evil and were insolent.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the people of Noah before. Indeed, it was they who were [even] more unjust and oppressing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and the people of Noah; they were the most unjust and rebellious people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the people of Nuh before; surely they were most unjust and inordinate;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and before them the people of Noah who were even more unjust and insolent;

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And before them, the people of Noah, for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham, and gave prophethood to their progeny and the Book, and some of them are well-directed, but many of them are disobedient.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent Noah, and Abraham, and We appointed the Prophecy and the Book to be among their seed; and some of them are guided, and many of them are ungodly.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Nuh and Ibrahim, and We placed in the posterity of the twain the prophecy and the Book. Then of them some are guided ones, and many of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) and Ibrahim (Abraham), and placed in their offspring Prophethood and Scripture, and among them there is he who is guided, but many of them are Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and the Scripture. Some of them are guided, but many of them are sinners.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed We sent forth Noah and Abraham and established in their line Prophecy and the Book. Then some of them embraced the guidance and many of them are wicked.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed, We sent Nuh and Ibrahim, and placed in their offspring prophethood and Scripture. And among them there are some who are guided; but many of them are rebellious.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily sent Noah and Abraham and placed the prophethood and the scripture among their seed, and among them there is he who goeth right, but many of them are evil-livers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Noah and Abraham and We ordained among their descendants prophethood and the Book. Some of them are [rightly] guided, and many of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent forth Noah and Abraham, and appointed the Prophethood and the Book to be given to their descendants. Some were guided, but many wereimpious.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham and placed prophethood and the Book among their offsprings, some of whom have the right guidance. However, most of them are evil doers.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Nuh and Ibrahim and We gave to their offspring the (gift of) prophecy and the Book; so there are among them those who go aright, and most of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
