translation.text: We sent forth Noah and Abraham and bestowed upon their offspring prophethood and the Book. Some of them were rightly guided, but many others were transgressors.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and Revelation: and some of them were on right guidance. But many of them became rebellious transgressors.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob and guided them, as We had guided Noah before them, and of his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus We reward those who are upright and do good.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave to him Isaac and Jacob -- each one We guided, And Noah We guided before; and of his seed David and Solomon, Job and Joseph, Moses and Aaron -- even so We recompense the good-doers --

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We bestowed upon him Is-haq and Ya'qub: each one We guided. And Nuh We had guided afore, and of his progeny Da-ud and Sulaiman and Ayyub and Yusuf and Musa and Harun. And thus We recompense the well-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We bestowed upon him Ishaque (Isaac) and Ya'qub (Jacob), each of them We guided, and before him, We guided Nuh (Noah), and among his progeny Dawud (David), Sulaiman (Solomon), Ayub (Job), Yusuf (Joseph), Musa (Moses), and Harun (Aaron). Thus do We reward the good-doers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob—each of them We guided. And We guided Noah previously; and from his descendants David, and Solomon, and Job, and Joseph, and Moses, and Aaron. Thus We reward the righteous.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We bestowed upon Abraham (offspring) Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya'qub (Jacob) and each of them did We guide to the right way as We had earlier guided Noah to the right way; and (of his descendants We guided) Da'ud (David) and Sulayman (Solomon), Ayyub (Job), Yusuf (Joseph), Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron). Thus do We reward those who do good.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We bestowed upon him Ishaq and Ya`qub, each of them We guided, and before him, We guided Nuh and among his progeny Dawud, Sulayman, Ayyub, Yusuf, Musa, and Harun. Thus do We reward the good-doers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob; each of them We guided; and Noah did We guide aforetime; and of his seed (We guided) David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the good.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob and guided each of them. And Noah We had guided before, and from his offspring, David and Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses and Aaron—thus do We reward the virtuous—

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave him Isaac and Jacob and guided both; and We guided Noah before them, among his descendants were David and Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses and Aaron as such, We recompense the gooddoers,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We gave to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - all [of them] We guided. And Noah, We guided before; and among his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob. Both had received Our guidance. Noah received Our guidance before Abraham and so did his descendants: David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron. Thus is the reward for the righteous people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We gave to him Ishaq and Yaqoub; each did We guide, and Nuh did We guide before, and of his descendants, Dawood and Sulaiman and Ayub and Yusuf and Musa and Haroun; and thus do We reward those who do good (to others).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave him Isaac and Jacob, each of whom We guided as We had guided Noah before. Among his descendants were David and Solomon, and Job, Joseph, Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the righteous.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: SENT NOAH to his people to warn them before the painful punishment came upon them.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people, saying, 'Warn thy people, ere there come on them a painful chastisement.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily We! We sent Nuh Unto his people saying: warn thy people ere there come Unto them torment afflictive.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people (Saying): "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful torment."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people: “Warn your people before there comes upon them a painful punishment.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people (and directed him): “Warn your people before a grievous chastisement comes upon them.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, We sent Nuh to his people (saying): "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful torment."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! We sent Noah unto his people (saying): Warn thy people ere the painful doom come unto them.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed We sent Noah to his people, [saying,] ‘Warn your people before a painful punishment overtakes them.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Noah to his nation, saying: 'Give warning to your nation before a painful punishment overtakes them'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people telling him, "Warn your people before a painful torment approaches them".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely We sent Nuh to his people, saying: Warn your people before there come upon them a painful chastisement.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Noah forth to his people, saying, "Warn your people before there comes upon them a grievous punishment."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah to his People (with the Command): "Do thou warn thy People before there comes to them a grievous Penalty."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But they did not listen to me," Noah said, "and followed him whose wealth and children only added to his ruin.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Noah said, 'My Lord, they have rebelled against me, and followed him whose wealth and children increase him only in loss,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Nuh said. my Lord! verily they have disobeyed me and followed them whose riches and children have only increased them in loss.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Nuh (Noah) said: "My Lord! They have disobeyed me, and followed one whose wealth and children give him no increase but only loss.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Noah said, “My Lord, they have defied me, and followed him whose wealth and children increase him only in perdition.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Noah said: “My Lord, they did not pay heed to what I said, and followed those (nobles) whose possession of wealth and children has led them to an even greater loss.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Nuh said: "My Lord! They have disobeyed me, and followed one whose wealth and children give him no increase but loss."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Noah said: My Lord! Lo! they have disobeyed me and followed one whose wealth and children increase him in naught save ruin;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Noah said, ‘My Lord! They have disobeyed me, following someone whose wealth and children only add to his loss,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Noah said: 'My Lord, they have rebelled against me and followed he whose wealth and offspring increase him only in loss,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Noah said, "Lord, they have disobeyed me and followed those whose wealth and children will only bring about destruction for them.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Nuh said: My Lord! surely they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children have added to him nothing but loss.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Noah supplicated, "Lord, they have disobeyed me, and followed those whose wealth and children have only added to their ruin;

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Noah said: "O my Lord! They have disobeyed me, but they follow (men) whose wealth and children give them no increase but only Loss.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Noah said: "O Lord, do not leave a single habitation of unbelievers on the earth.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Noah said, 'My Lord, leave not upon the earth of the unbelievers even one.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Nuh said: my Lord! leave not upon the earth of the infidels one inhabitant.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Nuh (Noah) said: "My Lord! Leave not one of the disbelievers on the earth!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Noah said, “My Lord, do not leave of the unbelievers a single dweller on earth.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Noah said: “My Lord, do not leave out of these unbelievers even a single dweller on earth,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Nuh said: "My Lord! Leave not one of the disbelievers on the earth Dayyar!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Noah said: My Lord! Leave not one of the disbelievers in the land.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Noah said, ‘My Lord! ‘Do not leave on the earth any inhabitant from among the faithless.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And Noah (supplicated) saying: 'My Lord, do not leave a single unbeliever upon the earth.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Noah said, "Lord, do not leave a single disbeliever on earth;

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Nuh said: My Lord! leave not upon the land any dweller from among the unbelievers:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Noah prayed, "O my Lord! Do not leave on earth a single one of those who deny the truth --

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And Noah, said: "O my Lord! Leave not of the Unbelievers, a single one on earth!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people, and he said: "O people worship God; you have no other god but He; for I fear the retribution of the great Day may fall on you."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent Noah to his people; and he said, 'O my people, serve God! You have no god other' than He; truly, I fear for you the chastisement of a dreadful day.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Assuredly We sent Nuh unto his people, and he said: O my people! worship Allah; no god ye have but He; verily I fear for you the torment of a mighty day.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people and he said: "O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other Ilah (God) but Him. (La ilaha ill-Allah: none has the right to be worshipped but Allah). Certainly, I fear for you the torment of a Great Day!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people. He said, “O my people! Worship God; you have no god other than Him. I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed We sent forth Noah to his people and he said: 'O my people! Serve Allah, you have no other god than Him Indeed I fear for you the chastisement of an awesome Day.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Indeed, We sent Nuh to his people and he said: "O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other god but Him. Certainly, I fear for you the torment of a Great Day!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We sent Noah (of old) unto his people, and he said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him. Lo! I fear for you the retribution of an Awful Day.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Noah to his people. He said, ‘O my people, worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Indeed I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous day.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent forth Noah to his nation. He said: 'Worship Allah, my people for you have no god except He. I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people. He told them, "Worship God for He is your only Lord. I am afraid of the punishment that you might suffer on the great Day (of Judgment)".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Certainly We sent Nuh to his people, so he said: O my people! serve Allah, you have no god other than Him; surely I fear for you the chastisement of a grievous day.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people. He said, "O my people, worship God; you have no other god but He. I fear for you the punishment of a dreadful Day,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah to his people. He said: "O my people! worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him. I fear for you the punishment of a dreadful day!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Has not the account of those before them come to them, -- of the people of Noah and 'Ad and Thamud, of Abraham and Midian, and all the habitations that were destroyed? Their apostles had come to them with clear proofs; and God did not surely wrong them, they wronged themselves.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Has there not come to you the tidings of those who were before you -- the people of Noah, Ad, Thamood, the people of Abraham, the men of Midian and the subverted cities? Their Messengers came to them with the clear signs God would not wrong them, but themselves they wronged.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Have not come to them the tidings of those before them: the people of Nuh and 'Ad and Thamud and the people of Ibrahim and the dwellers of Madyan and of the overturned cities! There came unto them their apostles with evidences. Wherefore Allah was not one to wrong them, but themselves they were wont to wrong.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Has not the story reached them of those before them? - The people of Nuh (Noah), 'Ad, and Thamud, the people of Ibrahim (Abraham), the dwellers of Madyan (Midian) and the cities overthrown [i.e. the people to whom Lout (Lot) preached], to them came their Messengers with clear proofs. So it was not Allah Who wronged them, but they used to wrong themselves.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Have they not heard the stories of those before them? The people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood; and the people of Abraham, and the inhabitants of Median, and the Overturned Cities? Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs. God never wronged them, but they used to wrong their own selves.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Have they not heard the accounts of those who came before them - of the people of Noah and 'Ad and Thamud, and the people of Abraham and the dwellers of Madyan (Midian), and the cities that were overturned? Their Messengers came to them with Clear Signs. Then, it was not Allah Who caused them any wrong; they rather wronged themselves.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Has not the story reached them of those before them -- The people of Nuh,`Ad, Thamud, the people of Ibrahim, the dwellers of Madyan and the overturned cities; to them came their Messengers with clear proofs. So it was not Allah Who wronged them, but they used to wrong themselves.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Hath not the fame of those before them reached them - the folk of Noah, A'ad, Thamud, the folk of Abraham, the dwellers of Midian and the disasters (which befell them)? Their messengers (from Allah) came unto them with proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty). So Allah surely wronged them not, but they did wrong themselves.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Has there not come to them the account of those who were before them—the people of Noah, ‘Ad, and Tham£d, and the people of Abraham, the inhabitants of Midian, and the towns that were overturned? Their apostles brought them manifest proofs. So it was not Allah who wronged them, but it was they who used to wrong themselves.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Have they not heard the news of those who have gone before them? The news of the nations of Noah, Aad and Thamood, of Abraham's nation, and the people of Midian and the ruined cities? Their Messengers showed them clear signs. Allah did not harm them, but they harmed themselves.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Has there not reached them the news of those before them - the people of Noah and [the tribes of] 'Aad and Thamud and the people of Abraham and the companions of Madyan and the towns overturned? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Have they not heard the stories of the people of Noah, the tribe of Ad, Thamud, the people of Abraham, the dwellers of the city of Midian, and those of the Subverted Cities? God's Messengers came to each of them with miracles. God did not do any injustice to them, but they wronged themselves.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Has not the news of those before them come to them; of the people of Nuh and Ad and Samood, and the people of Ibrahim and the dwellers of Madyan and the overthrown cities; their apostles came to them with clear arguments; so it was not Allah Who should do them injustice, but they were unjust to themselves.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Have they never heard the stories about their predecessors, the peoples of Noah, 'Ad, Thamud, Abraham, Midian, and of the ruined cities? Their messengers brought them clear evidence of the truth. It was not God who wronged them; they wronged themselves.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Hath not the story reached them of those before them?- the People of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud; the People of Abraham, the men of Midian, and the cities overthrown. To them came their messengers with clear signs. It is not Allah Who wrongs them, but they wrong their own souls.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "O Noah", He answered, "truly he is not of your family. He is surely the outcome of an unrighteous act. So ask Me not of what you do not know. I warn you not to be one of the ignorant."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said He, 'Noah, he is not of thy family; it is a deed not righteous. Do not ask of Me that whereof thou hast no knowledge. I admonish thee, lest thou shouldst be among the ignorant.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: O Nuh! verily he is not of thy household; verily he is of unrighteous Conduct; wherefore ask Me not that whereof thou hast no knowledge; verily I exhort thee not to be of the ignorants.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "O Nuh (Noah)! Surely, he is not of your family; verily, his work is unrighteous, so ask not of Me that of which you have no knowledge! I admonish you, lest you be one of the ignorants."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “O Noah, he is not of your family. It is an unrighteous deed. So do not ask Me about something you know nothing about. I admonish you, lest you be one of the ignorant.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: In response Noah was told: 'Most certainly he is not of your family; verily he is of unrighteous conduct. So do not ask of Me for that concerning which you have no knowledge. I admonish you never to act like the ignorant ones.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "O Nuh! Surely, he is not of your family; verily, his work is unrighteous, so ask not of Me that of which you have no knowledge! I admonish you, lest you should be one of the ignorant."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: O Noah! Lo! he is not of thy household; lo! he is of evil conduct, so ask not of Me that whereof thou hast no knowledge. I admonish thee lest thou be among the ignorant.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Said He, ‘O Noah! Indeed, He is not of your family. Indeed, he is [personification of] unrighteous conduct. So do not ask Me [something] of which you have no knowledge. I advise you lest you should be among the ignorant.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Noah, he is not of your family. It is not a good deed. Do not ask Me about things of which you have no knowledge. I reproach you lest you become among the ignorant'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "O Noah, indeed he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous, so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge. Indeed, I advise you, lest you be among the ignorant."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: O Nuh! surely he is not of your family; surely he is (the doer of) other than good deeds, therefore ask not of Me that of which you have no knowledge; surely I admonish you lest you may be of the ignorant

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God said, "Noah, he was not one of your family. For, indeed, he was unrighteous in his conduct. Do not question Me about something of which you have no knowledge; I admonish you lest you become like an ignorant man."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "O Noah! He is not of thy family: For his conduct is unrighteous. So ask not of Me that of which thou hast no knowledge! I give thee counsel, lest thou act like the ignorant!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Has not the news of those before you, the people of Noah and 'Ad and Thamud, and those who came after them, come to you? None knows (about) them except God. Their apostles came to them with clear proofs, but they tried to silence them and said: "We do not believe in what you have been sent with, and we are in doubt of what you call us to, about which we are in disquiet.'

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Has there not come to you the tidings of those who were before you -- the people of Noah, Ad, Thamood, and of those after them whom none knows but God? Their Messengers came to them with the clear signs; but they thrust their hands into their mouths, saying, 'We certainly disbelieve in the Message you have been sent with, and we are in doubt, concerning that you call us unto, disquieting.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Hath not the tidings come to you of those before you: the people of Nuh and the 'Aad and the Thamud and those after them! None knoweth them save Allah. There came unto them their apostles with the evidences, but they put their hands to their mouths, and said: verily we disbelieve in that where- with ye have been sent, and verily regarding that to which ye call Us We are in doubt disquieting.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Has not the news reached you, of those before you, the people of Nuh (Noah), and 'Ad, and Thamud? And those after them? None knows them but Allah. To them came their Messengers with clear proofs, but they put their hands in their mouths (biting them from anger) and said: "Verily, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and we are really in grave doubt as to that to which you invite us (i.e. Islamic Monotheism)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Has not the story reached you, of those before you, the people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood—and those after them? None knows them except God. Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs, but they tried to silence them, and said, “We reject what you are sent with, and we are in serious doubt regarding what you are calling us to.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Have the accounts of your predecessors not reached you: the people of Noah, the Ad, the Thamud, and those who came after them - they whose number is not known to any except Allah? Their Messengers came to them with Clear Signs, but they thrust their hands in their mouths, and said: "We do surely reject the Message you have brought, and we are in disquieting doubt about what you are summoning us to."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Has not the news reached you, of those before you, the people of Nuh, `Ad, and Thamud And those after them None knows them but Allah. To them came their Messengers with clear proofs, but they put their hands in their mouths and said: "Verily, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and we are really in grave doubt as to that to which you invite us."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Hath not the history of those before you reached you: the folk of Noah, and (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, and those after them? None save Allah knoweth them. Their messengers came unto them with clear proofs, but they thrust their hands into their mouths, and said: Lo! we disbelieve in that wherewith ye have been sent, and lo! we are in grave doubt concerning that to which ye call us.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Has there not come to you the account of those who were before you—the people of Noah, ‘Ad and Thamud, and those who were after them, whom no one knows [well] except Allah? Their apostles brought them manifest proofs, but they did not respond to them, and said, ‘We disbelieve in what you have been sent with. Indeed we have grave doubts concerning that to which you invite us.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Have you not heard what befell the nations that have gone before you? The nations of Noah, Aad, and Thamood, and those who came after? None knows them but Allah. Their Messengers came to them with clear signs, but they thrust their hands into their mouths and said: 'Without doubt we disbelieve the Message you have been sent with. That which you call us to is disquieting'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Has there not reached you the news of those before you - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them? No one knows them but Allah. Their messengers brought them clear proofs, but they returned their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Have you (believers) ever heard the news about those who lived before you, like the people of Noah, Ad, Thamud, and those who lived after them? No one knows about them except God. Messengers were sent to them with miracles, but they put their hands to their mouths and said, "We do not believe in whatever you preach and we are also doubtful and uncertain about that to which you invite us."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Has not the account reached you of those before you, of the people of Nuh and Ad and Samood, and those after them? None knows them but Allah. Their apostles come to them with clear arguments, but they thrust their hands into their mouths and said: Surely we deny that with which you are sent, and most surely we are in serious doubt as to that to which you invite us.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Has not the story reached you, (O people!), of those who (went) before you? - of the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud? - And of those who (came) after them? None knows them but Allah. To them came messengers with Clear (Signs); but they put their hands up to their mouths, and said: "We do deny (the mission) on which ye have been sent, and we are really in suspicious (disquieting) doubt as to that to which ye invite us."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: If they accuse you of falsehood, (remember that) the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud had accused (their apostles) before,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: If they cry lies to thee, so too before them the people of Noah cried lies, and Ad and Thamood,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And if they belie thee, then surely there have belied before them the people of Nuh and the 'Aad and the Thamud.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And if they belie you (O Muhammad SAW), so were belied the Prophets before them, (by) the people of Nuh (Noah), 'Ad and Thamud,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: If they deny you—before them the people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood also denied.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And if they deny you, so did deny before them the people of Nuh, `Ad and Thamud.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: If they deny thee (Muhammad), even so the folk of Noah, and (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, before thee, denied (Our messengers);

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: If they impugn you, the people of Noah had impugned before them and ‘Ad and Thamud,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: If they belie you, so too before them, the nation of Noah belied, and Aad and Thamood

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so, before them, did the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud deny [their prophets],

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: If they have called you, (Muhammad), a liar, (remember that) the people of Noah, Ad, Thamud,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And if they reject you, then already before you did the people of Nuh and Ad and Samood reject (prophets).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: If your opponents deny you, remember that, before them, the people of Noah and the tribes of 'Ad and Thamud denied their messengers likewise.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: If they treat thy (mission) as false, so did the peoples before them (with their prophets),- the People of Noah, and 'Ad and Thamud;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will be stoned to death."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'If thou givest not over, Noah, thou shalt assuredly be one of the stoned.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "If you cease not, O Nuh (Noah)! You will surely be among those stoned (to death)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “If you do not refrain, O Noah, you will be stoned.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: "O Noah! If you do not desist, you will certainly become one of the accursed."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "If you cease not, O Nuh you will surely be among those stoned."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: If thou cease not, O Noah, thou wilt surely be among those stoned (to death).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Noah, if you do not desist, you will certainly be stoned [to death].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Noah' they replied, 'if you do not desist you shall be of those stoned'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "Noah, if you do not desist, you will, certainly, be stoned to death."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: If you desist not, O Nuh, you shall most certainly be of those stoned to death.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Noah, if you do not desist, you will be stoned."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "If thou desist not, O Noah! thou shalt be stoned (to death)."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Even before them the people of Noah, 'Ad, the mighty Pharoah,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Cried lies before them the people of Noah, and Ad, and Pharaoh, he of the tent-pegs,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Before them there have belied the people of Nuh and the 'Aad, and Fir'awn the owner of the stakes.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Before them (were many who) belied Messengers, the people of Nuh (Noah); and 'Ad; and Fir'aun (Pharaoh) the man of stakes (with which he used to punish the people),

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth; as did Aad, and Pharaoh of the Stakes.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah, Ad, and Pharaoh of the tent-pegs gave the lie (to the Messengers)

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Before them denied -- the people of Nuh; and `Ad; and Fir`awn the man of stakes,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The folk of Noah before them denied (their messenger) and (so did the tribe of) A'ad, and Pharaoh firmly planted,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Before them the nations of Noah, Aad and Pharaoh, and he of the tentpegs belied,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] 'Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of Noah, Ad and the dominating Pharaoh had rejected Our revelations.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The people of Nuh and Ad, and Firon, the lord of spikes, rejected (apostles) before them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth, as did the 'Ad and Pharaoh of the Stakes,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Before them (were many who) rejected messengers,- the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The people of Noah, Ar-Rass and Thamud denied before you,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Cried lies before them the people of Noah and the men of Er-Rass, and Thamood,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And before them the people of Nuh belied, and so did the dwellers Of Rass and the Thamud.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Denied before them (i.e. these pagans of Makkah who denied you, O Muhammad SAW) the people of Nuh (Noah), and the dwellers of Rass, and the Thamud,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth, and so did the dwellers of Russ, and Thamood.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Denied before them the people of Nuh, and the Dwellers of Rass, and Thamud,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The folk of Noah denied (the truth) before them, and (so did) the dwellers at Ar-Rass and (the tribe of) Thamud,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The people of Noah denied before them, and [so did] the people of Rass and Thamud,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Before them, the nation of Noah, the nation of ArRass belied and so did Thamood

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The people of Noah denied before them, and the companions of the well and Thamud

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of Noah, dwellers of the Ra's, Thamud,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: (Others) before them rejected (prophets): the people of Nuh and the dwellers of Ar-Rass and Samood,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Before them, the people of Noah and the people of Rass denied this truth; and so did the people of Thamud.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The people of Noah had denied before them, and had called Our votary a liar, and said: "He is possessed," and repulsed him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The people of Noah cried lies before them; they cried lies to Our servant, and said, 'A man possessed!' And he was rejected.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: There belied before them the people of Nuh. So they belied Our bondman Nuh and said: `a madman;' and moreover he was reproven.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The people of Nuh (Noah) denied (their Messenger) before them, they rejected Our slave, and said: "A madman!" and he was insolently rebuked and threatened.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah disbelieved. They rejected Our servant, and said, “Crazy,” and he was rebuked.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The people of Nuh denied (their Messenger) before them. They rejected Our servant and said: "A madman!" Wazdujir.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The folk of Noah denied before them, yea, they denied Our slave and said: A madman; and he was repulsed.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The people of Noah impugned before them. So they impugned Our servant and said, ‘A crazy man,’ and he was reviled.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Long) before them the nation of Noah belied. They belied Our worshiper saying: 'Mad' and he was reprimanded.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of Noah, who lived before them, had also rejected (Our guidance). They rejected Our servant and said, "He is an insane person so let us drive him away".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Before them the people of Nuh rejected, so they rejected Our servant and called (him) mad, and he was driven away.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The people of Noah denied [the truth] before them. They belied Our messenger saying, "He is mad!" He was rebuffed,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: God has struck a similitude for the unbelievers -- the wife of Noah, and the wife of Lot; for they were under two of Our righteous servants, but they betrayed them, so they availed them nothing whatsoever against God; so it was said, 'Enter, you two, the Fire with those who enter.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Allah propoundeth for those who disbelieve the similitude of the wife of Nuh and the wife of Lut. They were under two of our righteous bondmen; then they defrauded them. Wherefore the twain availed them naught against Allah, and it was said: enter ye twain the Fire with those who enter.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Allah sets forth an example for those who disbelieve, the wife of Nuh (Noah) and the wife of Lout (Lot). They were under two of our righteous slaves, but they both betrayed their (husbands by rejecting their doctrine) so they [Nuh (Noah) and Lout (Lot)] benefited them (their respective wives) not, against Allah, and it was said: "Enter the Fire along with those who enter!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: God illustrates an example of those who disbelieve: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants, but they betrayed them. They availed them nothing against God, and it was said, “Enter the Fire with those who are entering.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Allah has set forth for the unbelievers the parable of the wives of Noah and Lot. They were wedded to two of Our righteous servants, but each acted treacherously with her husband, and their husbands could be of no avail to them against Allah. The two of them were told: “Enter the Fire with all the others who enter it.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Allah sets forth an example for those who disbelieve: the wife of Nuh and the wife of Lut. They were under two of our righteous servants, but they both betrayed them. So, they availed them not against Allah and it was said: "Enter the Fire along with those who enter!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Allah citeth an example for those who disbelieve: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot, who were under two of Our righteous slaves yet betrayed them so that they (the husbands) availed them naught against Allah and it was said (unto them): Enter the Fire along with those who enter.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Allah cites an example of the faithless: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of our righteous servants, yet they betrayed them. So they did not avail them in any way against Allah, and it was said [to them], ‘Enter the Fire, along with those who enter [it].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Allah has given as an example for the unbelievers, the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were married to two of Our righteous worshipers, but theybetrayed them. It was not for (Noah and Lot) to avail them a thing. It was said to them both: 'Enter the Fire with those who shall enter'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Allah presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them, so those prophets did not avail them from Allah at all, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who enter."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: God has told the disbelievers the story of the wives of Noah and Lot as a parable. They were married to two of Our righteous servants but were unfaithful to them. Nothing could protect them from the (wrath) of God and they were told to enter hell fire with the others.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Allah sets forth an example to those who disbelieve the wife of Nuh and the wife of Lut: they were both under two of Our righteous servants, but they acted treacherously towards them so they availed them naught against Allah, and it was said: Enter both the fire with those who enter.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: As an example to those who are bent on denying the truth, God cited the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot, who were married to two of Our righteous servants, but who betrayed them. So they could not help them against God, and they were told, "Enter the Fire along with all the others."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Allah sets forth, for an example to the Unbelievers, the wife of Noah and the wife of Lut: they were (respectively) under two of our righteous servants, but they were false to their (husbands), and they profited nothing before Allah on their account, but were told: "Enter ye the Fire along with (others) that enter!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "How many generations have We laid low after Noah, for your Lord knows and notices well enough the sins of His creatures.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: How many generations We have destroyed after Noah! Thy Lord suffices as one who is aware of and sees the sins of His servants.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: How many a generation have We destroyed after Nuh; and sufficeth for the offences of His bondmen thy Lord as the Aware, the Beholder.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And how many generations have We destroyed after Nuh (Noah)! And Sufficient is your Lord as an All-Knower and All-Beholder of the sins of His slaves.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: How many generations have We destroyed after Noah? Your Lord is sufficient as Knower and Beholder of the sins of his servants.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And how many generations have We destroyed after Nuh! And sufficient is your Lord as All-Knower and Seer of the sins of His servants.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: How many generations have We destroyed since Noah! And Allah sufficeth as Knower and Beholder of the sins of His slaves.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: How many generations We have destroyed since Noah! Your Lord is sufficient as [a witness who is] well aware and percipient of His servants’ sins.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: How many generations have We destroyed since Noah! Your Lord suffices as One who is Aware of and sees the sins of His worshipers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We have destroyed many generations after the time of Noah. Your Lord is All knowing and Well Aware of the sins of His servants.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And how many of the generations did We destroy after Nuh! and your Lord is sufficient as Knowing and Seeing with regard to His servants' faults.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: How many generations have We destroyed after Noah? and enough is thy Lord to note and see the sins of His servants.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The people of Noah accused the apostles of lies.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The people of Noah cried lies to the Envoys

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The people of Nuh (Noah) belied the Messengers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The people of Noah disbelieved the messengers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The people of Noah gave the lie to the Messengers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The people of Nuh denied the Messengers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The people of Noah impugned the apostles

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The nation of Noah, belied their Messengers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The people of Noah denied the messengers

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of Noah rejected the Messengerss.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The people of Nuh rejected the apostles.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The people of Noah also rejected the messengers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The people of Noah rejected the messengers.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Like the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud, and those that came after them. God does not want to be unjust to His creatures.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Like the wont of the people of Nuh and A'ad and Thamud and those after them, and God intendeth not any wrong Unto His bondmen.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Like the fate of the people of Nuh (Noah), and 'Ad, and Thamud and those who came after them. And Allah wills no injustice for (His) slaves.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Like the fate of the people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood, and those after them. God wants no injustice for the servants.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: like the day that overtook the people of Noah and Ad and Thamud, and those who came after them. Allah does not wish to subject His servants to any injustice.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Like the end of the people of Nuh, and `Ad, and Thamud and those who came after them. And Allah wills no injustice for (His) servants."

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: like the case of the people of Noah, of Ad and Thamud, and those who came after them, and Allah does not desire any wrong for [His] servants.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: or, something similar to the circumstances of the nations of Noah, Aad, and Thamood, and those who came after them. Allah does not want to wrong His worshipers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Like the custom of the people of Noah and of 'Aad and Thamud and those after them. And Allah wants no injustice for [His] servants.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: people of Noah, Ad, Thamud, and those after them. God did not want injustice for His servants.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The like of what befell the people of Nuh and Ad and Samood and those after them, and Allah does not desire injustice for (His) servants;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: like the fate of the people of Noah, 'Ad, Thamud, and those who came after them -- God never wills injustice on His creatures.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Something like the fate of the People of Noah, the 'Ad, and the Thamud, and those who came after them: but Allah never wishes injustice to his Servants.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "I shall go up a mountain," he said, "which will keep me from the water." "There is no getting away," said Noah, "from the decree of God today, except for those on whom be His mercy." And a wave came between them, and he was among those who were drowned.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: I shall betake me to a mountain which will defend me from the water. Nuh said: there is no defender to-day from the decree of Allah save for one on whom He hath mercy. And a wave intervened betwixt the twain; so he was of the drowned.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The son replied: "I will betake myself to a mountain, it will save me from the water." Nuh (Noah) said: "This day there is no saviourfrom the Decree of Allah except him on whom He has mercy." And a wave came in between them, so he (the son) was among the drowned.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The son replied: 'I will go to a mountain for refuge and it will save me from the water.' Noah said: 'None can save anyone today from the command of Allah except those on whom He may have mercy.' Thereupon a wave swept in between the two and he was drowned.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The son replied: "I will betake myself to some mountain, it will save me from the water." Nuh said: "This day there is no savior from the decree of Allah except him on whom He has mercy." And waves came in between them, so he (the son) was among the drowned.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: I shall betake me to some mountain that will save me from the water. (Noah) said: This day there is none that saveth from the commandment of Allah save him on whom He hath had mercy. And the wave came in between them, so he was among the drowned.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But he replied: 'I shall seek refuge on a mountain, which will protect me from the water' He (Noah) said: 'Today, there is no defender from the command of Allah, except those to whom He has mercy' And the waves came between them, and he was drowned.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [But] he said, "I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water." [Noah] said, "There is no protector today from the decree of Allah, except for whom He gives mercy." And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: His son replied, "I shall climb up a mountain and this will save me from the flood." Noah said, "No one can escape on this day from God's command except those on whom He has mercy." The waves separated Noah from his son who was then drowned with the rest (of the unbelievers).

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: I will betake myself for refuge to a mountain that shall protect me from the water. Nuh said: There is no protector today from Allah's punishment but He Who has mercy; and a wave intervened between them, so he was of the drowned.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He replied, "I shall seek refuge on a mountain, which will save me from the water." Noah cried, "Today there is no refuge for anyone from God's command except for those to whom He shows mercy!" Thereupon, a wave swept in between them, and Noah's son was among those who were drowned.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The son replied: "I will betake myself to some mountain: it will save me from the water." Noah said: "This day nothing can save, from the command of Allah, any but those on whom He hath mercy! "And the waves came between them, and the son was among those overwhelmed in the Flood.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We had drowned the people of Noah when they had accused the apostles of lies, and turned them into an example for men. We have prepared a painful punishment for the wicked.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And the people of Noah, when they cried lies to the Messengers, We drowned them, and made them to be a sign to mankind; and We have prepared for the evildoers a painful chastisement.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And the people of Nuh! When they belied the apostles We drowned them, and made them a sign unto mankind. And We have gotten ready unto the wrong-doers a torment afflictive,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Nuh's (Noah) people, when they denied the Messengers We drowned them, and We made them as a sign for mankind. And We have prepared a painful torment for the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And the people of Noah: when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and made them a lesson for mankind. We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful retribution.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The same was the case with the people of Noah when they charged the Messenger with imposture: We drowned them and made them a sign of warning for entire mankind, and We have prepared a painful chastisement for the unjust.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The nation of Noah, We drowned them when they belied their Messenger, and made of them a sign to the nation. For the harmdoers We have prepared a painful punishment

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We drowned the people of Noah because of their rejection of the Messengers and made them evidence of the Truth for mankind. We have prepared a painful torment for the unjust ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the people of Nuh, when they rejected the apostles, We drowned them, and made them a sign for men, and We have prepared a painful punishment for the unjust;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We drowned the people of Noah also when they rejected their messengers and We made them an example to all mankind. We have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And the people of Noah,- when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them as a Sign for mankind; and We have prepared for (all) wrong-doers a grievous Penalty;-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Even then they denied him; so We saved him and those with him, in the ark, and established them in the land, and drowned those who denied Our signs. So think of the fate of those who were warned (and took no heed).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: But they cried him lies; so We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark, and We appointed them as viceroys, and We drowned those who cried lies to Our signs; then behold how was the end of them that were warned!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: So they belied him; then We delivered him and those with him in the ark, and We made them successors, while We drowned those who belied Our signs. Behold then what like hath been the end of those who were warned.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But they denounced him, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and We made them successors, and We drowned those who rejected Our signs. So consider the fate of those who were warned.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But they rejected Noah, calling him a liar. So We saved him and those who were with him in the Ark, and made them successors (to the authority in the land), and drowned all those who had rejected Our signs as false. Consider, then, the fate of those who had been warned (and still did not believe).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But they impugned him. So We delivered him and those who were with him in the ark and We made them the successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. So observe how was the fate of those who were warned!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But they belied him. Therefore We saved him and those who were with him in the Ark, and We made them caliphs, and We drowned those who belied Our verses. See what was the end of those who were warned!

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They rejected Noah. Then We saved him and his people in the Ark to make them the successors of the rest. The others, who had called Our revelations lies, were drowned. Consider the fate of those who (rejected) Our warnings!

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But they rejected him, so We delivered him and those with him in the ark, and We made them rulers and drowned those who rejected Our communications; see then what was the end of the (people) warned.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then they rejected him; then We delivered him and those with him in the Ark, and We made them successors; while We drowned the others who belied Our signs. Observe then the fate of those who had been forewarned.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They rejected Him, but We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark, and We made them inherit (the earth), while We overwhelmed in the flood those who rejected Our Signs. Then see what was the end of those who were warned (but heeded not)!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Build an ark under Our eye and as We instruct. Do not plead for those who have been wicked, for they shall certainly be drowned."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Make thou the Ark under Our eyes, and as We reveal; and address Me not concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And make thou the ark under Our eyes and Our Revelation; and address Me not regarding those that have done wrong; verily they are to be drowned.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “And build the Ark, under Our eyes, and with Our inspiration, and do not address Me regarding those who did wrong; they are to be drowned.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and build the Ark under Our eyes and Our direction. And do not supplicate Me concerning those who have engaged in wrong-doing. They are doomed to be drowned.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Build the ark before Our eyes and by Our revelation, and do not plead with Me for those who are wrongdoers: they shall indeed be drowned.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Build the Ark with Our seeing (and protection), and as We reveal. Do not speak to Me concerning the evildoers; they shall be drowned'

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: but to build the Ark under the supervision and guidance of his Lord. He was also told not to address any words to Him concerning the unjust for they were all to be drowned.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And make the ark before Our eyes and (according to) Our revelation, and do not speak to Me in respect of those who are unjust; surely they shall be drowned.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Build the Ark under Our eyes and in accordance with Our revelation. Do not plead with Me concerning the evil-doers. They shall certainly be drowned."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "But construct an Ark under Our eyes and Our inspiration, and address Me no (further) on behalf of those who are in sin: for they are about to be overwhelmed (in the Flood)."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So he built the ark; and when groups of his people passed by him, they scoffed at him. He said to them: "Though you laugh at us (now), we shall laugh at you, as you are laughing at us.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So he was making the Ark; and whenever a council of his people passed by him they scoffed at him, He said, 'If you scoff at us, we shall surely scoff at you, as you scoff

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And he was making the ark; and whenever the chiefs of his people passed by him, they scoffed at him. He said: if ye scoff at us, verily we also scoff at you even as ye scoff at us.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: As he was building the ark, whenever some of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, “If you ridicule us, we will ridicule you, just as you ridicule.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: As Noah was building the Ark, whenever the leading men of his nation passed by him, they would scoff at him. He said: 'If you scoff at us, we too scoff at you in like manner.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: As he was building the ark, whenever the elders of his people passed by him, they would ridicule him. He said, ‘If you ridicule us [today], we shall ridicule you [tomorrow] just as you ridicule us [now].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Whenever an assembly of his nation passed by him as he was building the Ark, they mocked him. Whereupon he said: 'If you mock us, we shall indeedmock you, just as you mock.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Noah) started to build the Ark but whenever some of his people passed by, they would mock him. He in return would reply, "Mock us, but just as you mock us, we, too, will mock you.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And he began to make the ark; and whenever the chiefs from among his people passed by him they laughed at him. He said: If you laugh at us, surely we too laugh at you as you laugh (at us).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So he began to build the Ark, and whenever leaders of his people passed by, they scoffed at him. He said, "If you are scoffing at us, we shall scoff at you [and your ignorance], just as you scoff at us:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Forthwith he (starts) constructing the Ark: Every time that the chiefs of his people passed by him, they threw ridicule on him. He said: "If ye ridicule us now, we (in our turn) can look down on you with ridicule likewise!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We asked him to build the ark under Our eyes and guidance, (and said): "When Our command is issued and the source of water boils over, put a pair of every species in it, and your family except those for whom Our sentence has been passed already; and do not speak to Me for those who are wicked: They will be drowned.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We said to him, 'Make thou the Ark under Our eyes and as We reveal, and then, when Our command comes and the Oven boils, insert in it two of every kind and thy, family -- except for him against whom the word already has been spoken; and address Me not concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We revealed unto him, saying: build the ark under Our eyes and Our Revelation; then when Our command cometh and the oven boileth over, make way therein of every pair two, and thy household save him thereof against whom there hath already gone forth the word; and address me not in respect of those who have done wrong; verily they are to be drowned.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So We inspired him: “Build the Ark under Our observation and by Our inspiration. And when Our decree comes to pass, and the oven boils over, load into it two pairs of every kind, together with your family, except those of them against whom the word has already been pronounced. And do not speak to me concerning those who did wrong; for they are to be drowned.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon We revealed to him, saying: "Build the Ark under Our eyes and according to Our revelation. And when Our command comes to pass and the oven boils over, take on board a pair each from every species, and also take your household except those of them against whom sentence has already been passed and do not plead to Me on behalf of the wrong-doers. They are doomed to be drowned.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So We revealed to him: ‘Build the ark before Our eyes and by Our revelation. When Our edict comes and the oven gushes [a stream of water], bring into it a pair of every kind [of animal], and your family, except those of them against whom the decree has gone beforehand, and do not plead with Me for those who are wrongdoers: they shall indeed be drowned.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We said to him: 'Make the Ark under Our Eye, and Our Revelation, and then when Our command comes and the oven gushes water, take onboard a pair from every kind and your family, except him against whom the decision has already been passed. Do not address Me concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We inspired him, saying, "Build the Ark before Our eyes and by the instruction of Our revelation. When our decree comes to pass and water comes forth from the Oven, embark in the Ark with a pair of every kind of animals and your family except those already doomed (to perish). Do not plead with Me for the unjust; they will be drowned."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So We revealed to him, saying: Make the ark before Our eyes and (according to) Our revelation; and when Our command is given and the valley overflows, take into it of every kind a pair, two, and your followers, except those among them against whom the word has gone forth, and do not speak to Me in respect of those who are unjust; surely they shall be drowned.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then We revealed Our will to him: "Build the Ark under Our watchful eye according to Our instructions. When Our command comes, and waters gush up out of the earth, take on board pairs of every species and members of your household, except for any of them on whom sentence has already been passed -- do not plead with Me for those who have done wrong: they shall be drowned.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our Command, and the fountains of the earth gush forth, take thou on board pairs of every species, male and female, and thy family- except those of them against whom the Word has already gone forth: And address Me not in favour of the wrong-doers; for they shall be drowned (in the Flood).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When you and those with you have boarded the ark, say: 'All praise be to God who has delivered us from the people who were sinful.'

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then, when thou art seated in the Ark and those with thee, say, "Praise belongs to God, who has delivered us from the people of the evildoers."

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And when thou art settled, thou and those with thee, in the ark, say thou: praise unto Allah who hath delivered us from the wrong doing people.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then, when you and those with you are settled in the Ark, say, “Praise be to God, who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And then when you and those accompanying you are firmly seated in the Ark, say: "Thanks be to Allah Who has delivered us from the wrong-doing people."

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘When you, and those who are with you, are settled in the ark, say, ‘‘All praise belongs to Allah, who has delivered us from the wrongdoing lot.’’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when you and all those with you are seated in the Ark, say: 'Praise be to Allah who has saved us from the harmdoing nation'

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When all of you settle in the Ark, say, "Only God Who has saved us from the unjust people deserves all praise".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when you are firmly seated, you and those with you, in the ark, say: All praise is due to Allah who delivered us from the unjust people:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When you and all your followers have settled in the Ark, say, "Praise be to God who has delivered us from a wicked people,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And when thou hast embarked on the Ark - thou and those with thee,- say: "Praise be to Allah, Who has saved us from the people who do wrong."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But they called him a liar, and We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and drowned the others who rejected Our signs, for they were a people purblind.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: But they cried him lies; so We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark, and We drowned those who cried lies to Our signs; assuredly they were a blind people.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then they belied him; there upon We delivered him and those with him in the ark, and drowned those who belied Our signs; verily they were a people blind.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But they called him a liar. So We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and We drowned those who rejected Our revelations. They were blind people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But they charged him with falsehood. Thereupon We delivered Noah and those who were with him in the Ark, and caused those who rejected Our signs as false to be drowned. Surely they were a blind folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But they denied him. So We delivered him and those who were with him in the ark, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a blind lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (But) they belied him, so We saved him and those who were with him in the Ark, and We drowned those who belied Our verses. Surely, they were a blind nation.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They accused him of telling lies. So We saved him and his companions in an ark and drowned those who called Our revelations mere lies. They were, no doubt, a blind people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But they called him a liar, so We delivered him and those with him in the ark, and We drowned those who rejected Our communications; surely they were a blind people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and We drowned those who rejected Our signs. They were indeed a blind people.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But they rejected him, and We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark: but We overwhelmed in the flood those who rejected Our signs. They were indeed a blind people!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Do you wonder that a warning has come to you from your Lord through a man who is one of you and warns you? Remember, He made you leaders after the people of Noah, and gave you a greater increase in your stature. So think of the favours of God; you may haply be blessed."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: What, do you wonder that a reminder from your Lord should come to you by the lips of a man from among you? That he may warn you; and remember when He appointed you as successors after the people of Noah, and increased you in stature broadly; remember God's bounties; haply you will prosper.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Marvel ye that an admonition from your Lord should come unto you upon a Man from amongst you in order that he may warn you? Remember what time He made you successors after the people, of Nuh, and increased you amply in stature Remember the benefits of Allah, that haply ye may fare well.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Do you wonder that there has come to you a Reminder (and an advice) from your Lord through a man from amongst you that he may warn you? And remember that He made you successors after the people of Nuh (Noah), and increased you amply in stature. So remember the graces (bestowed upon you) from Allah, so that you may be successful."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “Are you surprised that a reminder has come to you from your Lord, through a man from among you, to warn you? Remember how He made you successors after the people of Noah, and increased you greatly in stature. And remember God’s blessings, so that you may prosper.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Do you wonder that an exhortation should come to you from your Lord through a man from amongst yourselves that he may warn you? And do call to mind when He made you successors after the people of Noah and amply increased you in stature. Remember then the wondrous bounties of Allah, that you may prosper.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Do you wonder that there has come to you a Reminder (and an advice) from your Lord through a man from among you to warn you And remember that He made you successors (generations after generations) after the people of Nuh and increased you amply in stature. So remember the graces (bestowed upon you) from Allah so that you may be successful."

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Do you consider it odd that there should come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among yourselves, so that he may warn you? Remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah, and increased you vastly in creation. So remember Allah’s bounties so that you may be felicitous.’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you? And remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah and increased you in stature extensively. So remember the favors of Allah that you might succeed.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Does it seem strange to you that a reminder from your Lord should be sent to a man among you so that He may warn you? Recall when God appointed you as successors of the people of Noah and increased your power over other people. Give thanks to God for His blessings so that perhaps you will have everlasting happiness."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Do ye wonder that there hath come to you a message from your Lord through a man of your own people, to warn you? call in remembrance that He made you inheritors after the people of Noah, and gave you a stature tall among the nations. Call in remembrance the benefits (ye have received) from Allah: that so ye may prosper."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But We saved him and those with him in the ark, and made it a sign for the creatures of the world.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We delivered him and those in the ark, and made it a sign unto the worlds.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But We saved him, together with the company of the Ark, and We made it a sign for all peoples.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then We delivered him and those who were in the Ark, and made it a sign for all the nations.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But We saved him and all who were in the Ark, and made (the event) a sign to the worlds.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We saved Noah and the people in the Ark and made (their case) a miracle for the world.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So We delivered him and the inmates of the ark, and made it a sign to the nations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But We saved him and those who were with him in the Ark and made the event a sign for mankind.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But We saved him and the companions of the Ark, and We made the (Ark) a Sign for all peoples!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And their Prophet said to them, 'The sign of his kingship is that the Ark will come to you, in it a Shechina from your Lord, and a remnant of what the folk of Moses and Aaron's folk left behind, the angels bearing it. Surely in that shall be a sign for you, if you are believers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And their prophet said unto them: verily the sign of his dominion is that there shall come unto you the ark wherein is tranquillity from your Lord and the relic of that which the household of Musa and the household of Harun had left, the angels bearing it; verily, herein is a sign for you if ye are believers.

translation.author: Itani
